articles.title: Why FDA approval of sickle cell gene therapy is a 'big deal' - PBS NewsHour
articles.description: Sickle cell disease is a chronic, debilitating condition that affects nearly 100,000 Americans, most of them with African ancestry. Now, the FDA has approved a groundbreaking treatment for it that uses the gene-editing tool CRISPR. John Yang speaks with Yale …
